rooms.description: A welcoming entrance hall with an open layout to facilitate natural light and cross ventilation. The design incorporates traditional Kerala wooden arches and stone flooring.
A spacious living room designed for family gatherings with large windows to allow abundant natural light and ventilation. Incorporates Vastu principles by aligning with the east-west axis.
A dining area adjacent to the living room, featuring a traditional Kerala-style layout and stone accents. Designed for optimal ventilation with windows on either side.
A modern yet traditionally styled kitchen area equipped with local materials, ensuring adequate natural light from strategically placed windows and cross ventilation according to Vastu guidelines.
A primary bedroom designed for comfort and privacy with large windows and traditional Kerala aesthetics. Positioned according to Vastu norms to promote positive energy.
A secondary bedroom ensuring adequate natural light and airflow with a traditional Kerala design, adhering to local building norms and Vastu principles.
A dedicated space for staff, designed with simplicity in mind while maintaining traditional Kerala architectural elements and proper ventilation.
An entertainment space integrated into the living area, optimized for acoustics and lighting. Features built-in seating and soundproofing in line with traditional design aesthetics.
A compact storage area integrated within the living space for utilities and occasional items, designed to maintain a clutter-free environment.

openings.description: Main entrance door positioned in the north-east corner following Vastu principles for positive energy flow.
Secondary exit or service door located at the south-west, ensuring practicality and adherence to local building norms.
Large windows along the east wall to maximize natural morning light.
Windows on the west wall designed for cross ventilation and cooling in the afternoon heat.
